required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Recombinant Factor VIIa in Patients With Severe Bleeding
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-centre, Randomised, Double-blind, Parallel Group, Placebo Controlled Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Activated Recombinant Factor VII (rFVIIa/NovoSeven®/NiaStase®) in Severely Injured Trauma Patients With Bleeding Refractory to Standard Treatment

brief_summary.textblock:
This trial is conducted globally. The purpose of the trial is to evaluate that activated recombinant human factor VII (eptacog alfa (activated)) is safe and effective in severely injured trauma patients by assessing mortality and morbidity.
Please note that this trial and trial F7TRAUMA-1648 (NCT00323570) have been merged.

detailed_description.textblock: The decision to discontinue the F7TRAUMA-1711 trial is not due to any safety concerns. The result of the pre-planned futility analysis performed in June 2008 predicted a very low likelihood of reaching a successful outcome on the primary efficacy endpoint at the end of the trial and as a consequence, the company has decided to close the trial as this juncture.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants to die from day 0 to day 30 from all causes.
Morbidity reflects the number of patients who had pulmonary and/or renal dysfunction requiring ongoing medical intervention on day 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Days Alive and Free of Pulmonary and/or Renal Dysfunction Requiring Medical Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The number of days alive and free of pulmonary and/or renal dysfunction requiring medical intervention from day 0 to day 30.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Death From Time of First Dose
secondary_outcome.description: The time of first dose refers to the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Units of Transfused Red Blood Cells From Time of First Dose
secondary_outcome.description: The number of units of transfused red blood cells in the first 24 hours from the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Receiving 10 Units or More (Massive Transfusion) of Red Blood Cells From Time of Injury
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients receiving 10 units or more of red blood cells in the first 24 hours from the time of injury.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Units of All Allogeneic Transfusions From Time of First Dose
secondary_outcome.description: The number of units of all allogeneic transfusions in the first 24 hours from the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.

intervention.description: Sterile, freeze-dried powder in single-use vials to be reconstituted with sterile water for injection. Three doses of 200, 100 and 100 mcg/kg to be administered bolus i.v. (intravenous) over approx. three hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Trauma injury (blunt and/or penetrating) with evidence of active hemorrhage (torso and/or proximal lower extremity) refractory to blood component therapy and surgical haemostatic procedures at the time of randomisation

facility.name: Novo Nordisk Clinical Trial Call Center

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Eligible subjects were those with either blunt and/or penetrating trauma injuries and confirmed clinical indicators for active haemorrhage refractory to standard treatment (including blood component therapy and surgical haemostatic procedures).

group.title: rFVIIa, Blunt Trauma
group.description: Three single doses of activated recombinant human factor VII (rFVIIa) (200 mcg/kg, 100 mcg/kg, and 100 mcg/kg) administered over approximately three hours. First dose was administered within a maximum of 12 hours from injury. A second dose was to be administered one hour after the initial dose, and a third dose was to be administered three hours after the initial dose.

group.title: Placebo, Blunt Trauma
group.description: Three single doses of placebo (200 mcg/kg, 100 mcg/kg, and 100 mcg/kg) administered over approximately three hours. First dose was administered within a maximum of 12 hours from injury. A second dose was to be administered one hour after the initial dose, and a third dose was to be administered three hours after the initial dose.

group.title: rVIIa, Penetrating Trauma
group.description: Three single doses of activated recombinant human factor VII (rFVIIa) (200 mcg/kg, 100 mcg/kg, and 100 mcg/kg) administered over approximately three hours. First dose was administered within a maximum of 12 hours from injury. A second dose was to be administered one hour after the initial dose, and a third dose was to be administered three hours after the initial dose.

group.title: Placebo, Penetrating Trauma
group.description: Three single doses of placebo (200 mcg/kg, 100 mcg/kg, and 100 mcg/kg) administered over approximately three hours. First dose was administered within a maximum of 12 hours from injury. A second dose was to be administered one hour after the initial dose, and a third dose was to be administered three hours after the initial dose.

participants_list.participants: Two subjects withdrew due to ineligibility. Excluded from safety analysis set
Three subjects withdrew due to ineligibility, two subjects died. Excluded from safety analysis set
One subject withdrew due to ineligibility. Excluded from safety analysis set
Four subjects withdrew due to ineligibility, one subject died. Excluded from safety analysis set

outcome.title: Mortality
outcome.description: Number of participants to die from day 0 to day 30 from all causes.
outcome.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set. Patients who discontinued (withdrawn or lost to follow up) before day 30 were excluded from analyses. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

measure.title: Mortality
measure.description: Number of participants to die from day 0 to day 30 from all causes.
measure.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set. Patients who discontinued (withdrawn or lost to follow up) before day 30 were excluded from analyses. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

analysis.groups_desc: Test for Odds ratio=1, corresponding to a null hypothesis of no difference in mortality for patients who died between groups for Blunt Trauma. Odds-ratio is adjusted for baseline covariates: Age, Injury Severity Score (ISS), Glasgow Coma ­Scale Score (GCS), International Normalized Ratio (INR) and acute lung injury (P/F > 200). Missing covariates are imputed by the mean value.

Treatment groups are compared using a Cox Proportional Hazards model with treatment as factor and adjusting for age, Injury Severity Score (ISS), Glasgow Coma ­Scale Score(GCS), International Normalized Ratio (INR) and acute lung injury.

outcome.title: Morbidity
outcome.description: Morbidity reflects the number of patients who had pulmonary and/or renal dysfunction requiring ongoing medical intervention on day 30.
outcome.population: Blunt trauma patient population: According to protocol, morbidity is not part of the primary endpoint since non-inferiority test of mortality was not passed. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

measure.title: Morbidity
measure.description: Morbidity reflects the number of patients who had pulmonary and/or renal dysfunction requiring ongoing medical intervention on day 30.
measure.population: Blunt trauma patient population: According to protocol, morbidity is not part of the primary endpoint since non-inferiority test of mortality was not passed. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

outcome.title: Number of Days Alive and Free of Pulmonary and/or Renal Dysfunction Requiring Medical Intervention
outcome.description: The number of days alive and free of pulmonary and/or renal dysfunction requiring medical intervention from day 0 to day 30.
outcome.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

measure.title: Number of Days Alive and Free of Pulmonary and/or Renal Dysfunction Requiring Medical Intervention
measure.description: The number of days alive and free of pulmonary and/or renal dysfunction requiring medical intervention from day 0 to day 30.
measure.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

analysis.groups_desc: Baseline covariates: Age, Injury Severity Score (ISS), Glasgow Coma ­Scale Score (GCS), International Normalized Ratio (INR) and acute lung injury.

outcome.title: Time to Death From Time of First Dose
outcome.description: The time of first dose refers to the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.
outcome.population: There is no measure summary for time to event type of endpoint as this would be a Kaplan-Meier graph.

measure.title: Time to Death From Time of First Dose
measure.description: The time of first dose refers to the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.
measure.population: There is no measure summary for time to event type of endpoint as this would be a Kaplan-Meier graph.

outcome.title: Number of Units of Transfused Red Blood Cells From Time of First Dose
outcome.description: The number of units of transfused red blood cells in the first 24 hours from the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.
outcome.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set including patients who discontinued before day 30. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

measure.title: Number of Units of Transfused Red Blood Cells From Time of First Dose
measure.description: The number of units of transfused red blood cells in the first 24 hours from the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.
measure.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set including patients who discontinued before day 30. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.
measure.units: Units of transfused red blood cells

outcome.title: Number of Patients Receiving 10 Units or More (Massive Transfusion) of Red Blood Cells From Time of Injury
outcome.description: The number of patients receiving 10 units or more of red blood cells in the first 24 hours from the time of injury.
outcome.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set including patients who discontinued before day 30. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

measure.title: Number of Patients Receiving 10 Units or More (Massive Transfusion) of Red Blood Cells From Time of Injury
measure.description: The number of patients receiving 10 units or more of red blood cells in the first 24 hours from the time of injury.
measure.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set including patients who discontinued before day 30. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

outcome.title: Number of Units of All Allogeneic Transfusions From Time of First Dose
outcome.description: The number of units of all allogeneic transfusions in the first 24 hours from the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.
outcome.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set, including patients who discontinued before day 30. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

measure.title: Number of Units of All Allogeneic Transfusions From Time of First Dose
measure.description: The number of units of all allogeneic transfusions in the first 24 hours from the time of the first dose of rFVIIa or placebo.
measure.population: Blunt trauma patient population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) analysis set, including patients who discontinued before day 30. Penetrating Trauma patient population: No analysis done due to low statistical power.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected in a timespan of 90 days.
reported_events.desc: Safety population includes three patients in each blunt trauma treatment arm who were randomised received an initial dose and no further information is known. These patients were not included in the intent-to-treat (ITT) population.

group.title: rFVIIa, Blunt Trauma
group.description: Three single doses of activated recombinant human factor VII (rFVIIa) (200 mcg/kg, 100 mcg/kg, and 100 mcg/kg) administered over approximately three hours. First dose was administered within a maximum of 12 hours from injury. A second dose was to be administered one hour after the initial dose, and a third dose was to be administered three hours after the initial dose.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk acknowledges the Investigator’s right to publish the entire results of the trial in accordance with the latest Vancouver guidelines. Any such scientific paper, resentation, communication or other information concerning the investigation described in this protocol, must be submitted in writing to Novo Nordisk Trial Manager prior to submission for publication / presentation for comments. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the manuscript.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Trial was terminated after planned interim analysis for futility showed a lower than expected conditional power for showing superiority (11.2% [actual] vs. 50% [required]). 554 of 1502 planned patients were included in the intent-to-treat population.
